DataElement.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Mesorectal Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to a person having a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic which are relating to the fold of peritoneum, or mesentery, attached to the rectum.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Mesorectal Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic which are relating to the fold of peritoneum, or mesentery, attached to the rectum.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Mesorectal Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Of or relating to the fold of peritoneum, or mesentery, attached to the rectum.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Of or relating to the fold of peritoneum, or mesentery, attached to the rectum.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Evidence that tumor is adjace
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence that tumor is adjacent to (defined as within 3 mm of) the mesorectal fascia on pre-operative MRI or ERUS/pelvic CT scan

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence that tumor is adherent to or invading the mesorectal fascia on imaging studies such that the surgeon would not be able to perform an R0 resection (one with negative margins).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there evidence that the tumor is adjacent to (defined as within 3mm of) the mesorectal fascia on MRI or ERUS/pelvic CT (with IV contrast) scan?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
